Optimization on manifolds is a versatile framework for continuous optimization.

It encompasses optimization over vectors and matrices,

and adds the possibility to optimize over curved spaces to handle constraints and symmetries such as orthonormality, low rank, positivity and invariance under group actions.

Manopt makes it easy.

### Matlab ![](images/matlab_logo_small.png){width=25}

This website is the home of the Matlab version of Manopt.
Install from [downloads](downloads.qmd) or from our [GitHub repository](https://github.com/NicolasBoumal/manopt), then run a [first example](firstexample.qmd).
::::::

:::::: {.g-col-4}
### Python ![](images/python_logo_small.png){width=25}

The [PyManopt website](https://www.pymanopt.org/) houses the Python version of Manopt and its documentation.
Also check out the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/pymanopt/pymanopt).
::::::

:::::: {.g-col-4}
### Julia ![](images/julia_logo_small.png){width=25}

The [Manopt.jl website](https://www.manoptjl.org/) hosts the Julia version of Manopt and its documentation.
The [GitHub repository](https://github.com/JuliaManifolds/) has both Manopt.jl and Manifolds.jl.
